location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 7: James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, Temporarily in Charge of the Residency, Bushire, to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: In this letter James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, temporarily in charge of the Residency, provides details of presents from His Highness Ibrahim Khan [Ebrāhim Khan], Governor of Kerman [Kermān], to the Honourable Governor of Bombay, Mountstuart Elphinstone, which have been shipped on the Honourable Company cruiser, the Teignmouth. The presents include forty-seven shawls, one phial containing ottor [attar] of roses and two carpets. Dow encloses a bill of lading (not included) for the aforementioned presents.
